description: This alarm is raised when an incompatible connection to a peer at a
Vector Engine Port is detected by a card.
An incompatible connection would occur, if a vectoring client card
is connected to an incompatible vector engine port of the vectoring master
card or as a result of a hardware problem with the physical connector(s).
If this alarm is raised, check connection capabilities of port and peer
and the state of the physical connector(s).

Summary.eval: ($v4==5) ? 'Incompatible connection cleared from peer vector engine port' : 'Incompatible connection detected on peer vector engine port'

failed(2) One or more of the resources represented by the managed object has
an internal fault that prevents it from operating.

represented by this managed object are not in use.

cannot operate, because some other resource, which is not
represented by this managed object and on which it depends is
degraded(7) Functionality provided by one or more of the resources represented
by the managed object is degraded, but limited operation is still

description: Indicates the vectoring family with which the vectored card is capable of interworking.

vectored cards with the common family capabilities may become members of a given
This object is for informational purposes only and cannot be managed.

description: Indicates the maximum number of client vectored cards that may be connected to this card,
if the card takes the role of master vectoring card or server within a vectored system.
Only valid, if master(1) bit of sheVectoredCardVectoringRoleCapability is set.
This object is for informational purposes only and cannot be managed.
Depending on the connected card types, the maximum number of client cards that can
be connected to the master maybe fewer than the number reported here, if,
for example, the MaxClientPorts would be exceeded.

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerStatusChanged SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex u 0 SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerStatus i 1 SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerRequisiteConnModes b 0

$SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerStatusChanged SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex u 0 SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerStatus i 2 SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerRequisiteConnModes b 0

description: The sheVectorEnginePortIndex of the VEPort on the given VectoredCard identified by the
entPhysicalIndex of this entry through which this peer is reachable.
Some SU_SLV cards may require a fixed assignment of vectoring IU cards to their VE Ports,
e.g., IU card with lowest slot number in VE Port 1, IU card with next lowest slot number
in VE Port #2, etc. If this is the case, sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex will always
indicate the required VE Port on the given card to which peer card must to be connected,
even when the peer card is not connected.
Other SU_SLV cards may allow a IU card to connect to any VE Port on the SU_SLV.
In this case, sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex will only indicate the VEPort over which
the peer is reachable, if and only if the peer has been connected to a VE Port and is
reachable. When the peer is not reachable, sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex will be 0
Therefore, sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex is to be interpreted as given below:
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerVEPortIndex

description: The status of the reachability of this peer via the VEPort(s).
notReachable(1) - The peer cannot be reached.
reachable(2) - The peer can be reached via the VE Port indexed by
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerStatus

description: Indicates the requisite connection mode(s) that may be used to connect to
this peer of this Vectored Card via a Vector Engine Port located on the
In order to successfully connect to this peer, a connection must be
made via a local Vector Enging Port for which sheVectorEnginePortConnCapability
includes one or more of the requisite connection modes.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredCardVEPeerRequisiteConnModes

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).

description: A name unique across all instances of this managed object to identify
the specific instance when using CLI.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemName

description: The administrative state of the VectoredSystem.
Setting the adminState to the following values will have the following consequencies:
locked(1) If the operState = Enabled the operation of the resources will be shut
down and the operState will go into Disabled.
unlocked(2) If the operState = Disabled the resources will attempt go into operation
and, if successful the operState will go into Enabled.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemAdminState

description: The operational state of the VectoredSystem.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemOperState

description: The availability status conditions of an instance of a VectoredSystem.
failed(2) One or more of the resources represented by the managed object has
an internal fault that prevents it from operating.
offline(4) The resource has been administratively locked and all resources
represented by this managed object are not in use.
dependency(6) One or more of the resources represented by this managed object
cannot operate, because some other resource, which is not
represented by this managed object and on which it depends is
degraded(7) Functionality provided by one or more of the resources represented
by the managed object is degraded, but limited operation is still
The VectoredSystem is fully available if the operState is enabled and no availabilityStatus bit is set
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemAvailabilityStatus

description: Determines how the vectored system is to select disturbers to perform crosstalk cancelation for xDSL lines
automatic(1) The vectored system automatically determines the best groupings of xDSL
lines to determine the disturbers to perform crosstalk cancelation.
useVectoredGroups(2) The vectored system uses the configured vectored groups of xDSL lines of the vectored
system to determine the disturbers to perform crosstalk cancelation.
In R4.7.1M not configurable. Only automatic(1) is supported.

rPVector1(3) - The VCE is performing phase R-P-VECTOR 1 of the
oPVector11(4) - The VCE is performing phase O-P-VECTOR 1-1 of the
oPVector2(5) - The VCE is performing phase O-P-VECTOR 2 of the
oPVector21(6) - The VCE is performing phase O-P-VECTOR 2-1 of the
rPVector2(7) - The VCE is performing phase R-P-VECTOR 2 of the
joiningLinesInShowtime(8) - The VCE is in the process of joining lines in showtime
fastTrackDs(9) - The VCE is performing fast track in the downstream
fastTrackUs(10) - The VCE is performing fast track in the upstream

the specific instance when using CLI.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileName

description: The interpolation factor influences the selection of which DMT tone carriers will actually
be used to determine crosstalk coupling and for which crosstalk coefficients will be
calculated. For all other DMT tone carriers involved in vectoring, the crosstalk coupling
The following interpolation factors are possible:
Since the interpolation factor determines the tone spacing used to select DMT tone carriers
for which crosstalk coupling is actually determined, decreasing the interpolation factor will
increase the number of DMT tone carriers for which crosstalk coupling will be determined and
increasing the number of these DMT tone carriers will increase demand on computing power
and hardware resources. If sufficient resources are not available within the vectored
system to meet this demand, the vectored system may reduce the set of disturbers used for
cancellation and the effectiveness of vectoring would be reduced.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileInterpolationFactor

description: The orthogonal sequence length used by the Vectored System for alignment and synchronization
of lines within a vectored system.
Set as a power of 2. Only powers of 2 are permitted that result in a orthogonal sequence
Default: 6 (2 to the power of 6 = orthogonal sequence length of 64 bits)
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileOrthogonalSeqLen

Frequencies are identified using subcarrier indices that are always calculated

Per default all possible subcarrier frequencies are included, i.e., the default

Per default all possible subcarrier frequencies are included, i.e., the default

variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileNonVectoredBandDs

variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileNonVectoredBandUs

description: This object defines the maximum number of disturbers whose FEXT is to be cancelled in
the victim lines of the vectored system.
Attempt full cancellation for all lines within the vectored system (default)
>1 - The maximum number of disturber lines, whose FEXT is to be cancelled.
PLEASE NOTE: SPECIAL CARE MUST BE TAKEN WHEN MODIFYING THIS PARAMETER AS AN INCORRECT
CONFIGURATION MAY HAVE DETRIMENTAL EFFECT ON THE OPERATION OF THE VECTORED SYSTEM.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileMaxNoOfDisturbers

description: This object allows the optional configuration of the O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout to be used by the vectored system for initializing lines when the vectored
system has lines already in showtime.
In a vectored system, FEXT coupling channel coefficients must be estimated
or updated before the potential crosstalk occurs from the lines joining the vectored
system. Therefore, after the handshake phase, the FEXT coupling channel coefficients
are estimated from the initializing lines into the showtime lines through transmission
of the O-P-VECTOR 1 signal on the initializing lines.
Usually the joining lines will have differing handshake durations and will, therefore,
begin sending their O-P-VECTOR 1 signals at different points in time after the
completion of the handshake phase and O-P-QUIET 1 stage. This O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout defines how long the vectored system waits for initializing lines to send their
O-P-VECTOR 1 signals, before proceeding with the initialization. Once the timeout has
occurred, other initializing lines cannot join the vectored system and must wait until
initialization of the accepted lines reaches showtime.
Thus, varying the length of the synchronization timeout may have an impact on the
success rate of the number of lines being allowed to join a vectored system at any
The timeout is determined by the vectored system (default)
PLEASE NOTE: SPECIAL CARE MUST BE TAKEN WHEN MODIFYING THIS PARAMETER AS AN INCORRECT
CONFIGURATION MAY HAVE DETRIMENTAL EFFECT ON THE OPERATION OF THE VECTORED SYSTEM.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileOPVector1SynchTimeoutShowtime

description: This object allows the optional configuration of the O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout to be used by the vectored system for initializing lines when no other lines
within the vectored system are in showtime, e.g., at a full system start-up.
In a vectored system, FEXT coupling channel coefficients must be estimated
or updated before the potential crosstalk occurs from the lines joining the vectored
system. Therefore, after the handshake phase, the FEXT coupling channel coefficients
are estimated from the initializing lines into the showtime lines through transmission
of the O-P-VECTOR 1 signal on the initializing lines.
Usually the joining lines will have differing handshake durations and will, therefore,
begin sending their O-P-VECTOR 1 signals at different points in time after the
completion of the handshake phase and O-P-QUIET 1 stage. This O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout defines how long the vectored system waits for initializing lines to send their
O-P-VECTOR 1 signals, before proceeding with the initialization. Once the timeout has
occurred, other initializing lines cannot join the vectored system and must wait until
initialization of the accepted lines reaches showtime.
Thus, varying the length of the synchronization timeout may have an impact on the
success rate of the number of lines being allowed to join a vectored system at any
The timeout is determined by the vectored system (default)
PLEASE NOTE: SPECIAL CARE MUST BE TAKEN WHEN MODIFYING THIS PARAMETER AS AN INCORRECT
CONFIGURATION MAY HAVE DETRIMENTAL EFFECT ON THE OPERATION OF THE VECTORED SYSTEM.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileOPVector1SynchTimeoutNoShowtime

description: This object allows the configuration of the behavior for all cards that comprise the VectoredSystem
when a card becomes degraded and cannot take full part in FEXT cancellation.
doNothing(0) - The card takes no action
forceLinesDown(1) - The card forces all ports to be operationally 'down'
forceLinesFallback(2) - The card forces all ports into fallback mode.
If forceLinesFallback(2) is selected, but fallback mode for one or more lines is not configured
(in sheXdslMib), the line(s) may not successfully initialize.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileMemberCardDegradedBehavior

description: This object allows the configuration of the behavior of the VectoredSystem with regard to
how it recovers degraded cards that may be able to take full part in FEXT cancellation again.
automatic(1) - Once the VectoredSystem determines that a member card has the prerequisites to
take part in FEXT cancellation, the VectoredSystem automatically triggers the
member card to re-attempt participation in FEXT cancellation.
manual(2) - Degraded cards will only re-attempt to participation in FEXT cancellation, if
explicitly triggered to do so through invocation of the command recoverVectoring(6)
for the member card of the VectoredSystem.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileMemberCardRecoveryBehavior

description: Configuration notification on deletion of an instance of sheVectoredSystemProfileEntry.
The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileControlTimeStamp

The value zero is only allowed as an option for the control request createVectoredSystemProfile,

the newly created instance of sheVectoredSystemProfileEntry.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileControlIndex

timeout to be used by the vectored system for initializing lines when the vectored
system has lines already in showtime.
In a vectored system, FEXT coupling channel coefficients must be estimated
or updated before the potential crosstalk occurs from the lines joining the vectored
system. Therefore, after the handshake phase, the FEXT coupling channel coefficients
are estimated from the initializing lines into the showtime lines through transmission
of the O-P-VECTOR 1 signal on the initializing lines.
Usually the joining lines will have differing handshake durations and will, therefore,
begin sending their O-P-VECTOR 1 signals at different points in time after the
completion of the handshake phase and O-P-QUIET 1 stage. This O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout defines how long the vectored system waits for initializing lines to send their
O-P-VECTOR 1 signals, before proceeding with the initialization. Once the timeout has
occurred, other initializing lines cannot join the vectored system and must wait until
initialization of the accepted lines reaches showtime.
Thus, varying the length of the synchronization timeout may have an impact on the
success rate of the number of lines being allowed to join a vectored system at any
The timeout is determined by the vectored system (default)
PLEASE NOTE: SPECIAL CARE MUST BE TAKEN WHEN MODIFYING THIS PARAMETER AS AN INCORRECT
CONFIGURATION MAY HAVE DETRIMENTAL EFFECT ON THE OPERATION OF THE VECTORED SYSTEM.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileOPVector1SynchTimeoutShowtime

description: This object allows the optional configuration of the O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout to be used by the vectored system for initializing lines when no other lines
within the vectored system are in showtime, e.g., at a full system start-up.
In a vectored system, FEXT coupling channel coefficients must be estimated
or updated before the potential crosstalk occurs from the lines joining the vectored
system. Therefore, after the handshake phase, the FEXT coupling channel coefficients
are estimated from the initializing lines into the showtime lines through transmission
of the O-P-VECTOR 1 signal on the initializing lines.
Usually the joining lines will have differing handshake durations and will, therefore,
begin sending their O-P-VECTOR 1 signals at different points in time after the
completion of the handshake phase and O-P-QUIET 1 stage. This O-P-VECTOR 1 synchronization
timeout defines how long the vectored system waits for initializing lines to send their
O-P-VECTOR 1 signals, before proceeding with the initialization. Once the timeout has
occurred, other initializing lines cannot join the vectored system and must wait until
initialization of the accepted lines reaches showtime.
Thus, varying the length of the synchronization timeout may have an impact on the
success rate of the number of lines being allowed to join a vectored system at any
The timeout is determined by the vectored system (default)
PLEASE NOTE: SPECIAL CARE MUST BE TAKEN WHEN MODIFYING THIS PARAMETER AS AN INCORRECT
CONFIGURATION MAY HAVE DETRIMENTAL EFFECT ON THE OPERATION OF THE VECTORED SYSTEM.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileOPVector1SynchTimeoutNoShowtime

description: This object allows the configuration of the behavior of the VectoredSystem with regard to
how it recovers degraded cards that may be able to take full part in FEXT cancellation again.
automatic(1) - Once the VectoredSystem determines that a member card has the prerequisites to
take part in FEXT cancellation, the VectoredSystem automatically triggers the
member card to re-attempt participation in FEXT cancellation.
manual(2) - Degraded cards will only re-attempt to participation in FEXT cancellation, if
explicitly triggered to do so through invocation of the command recoverVectoring(6)
for the member card of the VectoredSystem.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileMemberCardRecoveryBehavior

description: This object allows the configuration of the behavior for all cards that comprise the VectoredSystem
when a card becomes degraded and cannot take full part in FEXT cancellation.
doNothing(0) - The card takes no action
forceLinesDown(1) - The card forces all ports to be operationally 'down'
forceLinesFallback(2) - The card forces all ports into fallback mode.
If forceLinesFallback(2) is selected, but fallback mode for one or more lines is not configured
(in sheXdslMib), the line(s) may not successfully initialize.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredSystemProfileMemberCardDegradedBehavior

description: Configuration notification on creation of a new instance of sheVectoredGroupEntry.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupCreated SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupControlTimeStamp u 9999 SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupName s EXAMPLE SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupAdminState i 1 SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupMemberPortList s EXAMPLE

description: The time stamp of the last command (end of command).
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupControlTimeStamp

description: A name unique across all instances of this managed object to identify
the specific instance when using CLI.
Spaces and other special characters (: ?) are not allowed!
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupName

description: The administrative state of the VectoredGroup.
Setting the adminState to the following values will have the following consequencies:
locked(1) - Deactivates vectoring of member xDSL lines.
When in the Locked state allows lines to be added to the VectoredGroup (provisioned)
without the individual lines initially participating in the vectoring.
The VectoredGroup can1 then be unlocked when all members have been added.
Unlocked(2) - The group has been made available for vectoring. Whether vectoring takes place
depends on the adminState of the VectoredSystem to which the VectoredGroup belongs.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupAdminState

description: A list of ifIndex of xDSL ports that belong to this group.
variables.name: SHE-VECTORING-MIB::sheVectoredGroupMemberPortList

A non-zero value is mandatory to identify the vectored system for which the vectored

Unlocked(2) - The group has been made available for vectoring. Whether vectoring takes place
